author: Staff Reporter
text:
Well before the election dates for the Assembly polls are announced by the Election Commission of India (ECI), the district administration has started gearing up for the conduct of elections as per the ECI guidelines.

The District Election Officer and Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan conducted the first phase of the training programme for Returning Officers and Assistant Returning Officers for the six Assembly segments in Kanyakumari district on Saturday, said Special Tahsildar (Elections) P. Subramanian.

P. Subramanian told The Hindu that the ROs and AROs were explained in detail about the Election Code of Conduct to be followed from the day of the announcement of election.

The ROs with the assistance of AROs should ensure that all the 1,658 polling booths in the district had basic amenities.

They were briefed about the rules to be followed while receiving nomination papers from candidates and also scrutiny.

They were apprised about the training programme to be conducted for Booth Level Officers on handling Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) and control units.

The training was given by resource persons R. Sivadoss, District Adi Dravidar Welfare Officer and Subbiah, Special Deputy Collector (Social Security Scheme).
title: ROs, AROs undergo training for upcoming polls
